channel.title: SilabSoft Client
channel.description:
Hello MoparScape. I post today with the problem of the SilabSoft downloadable client not working. Yes yes, I realise that this is an old subject, but for me, the SilabSoft client worked the best and achieved everything that I wanted. I've tried alternative clients, but I've really found nothing that matches what I personally need. Recently, I've got back in to RSPS, but have found that upon opening the run.bat reading:
[code]java -Xmx512m -jar SilabClient.jar 0 0 highmem members 0 pause[/code]
The client simply does not open; instead returning exactly what was written with no apparent errors:
[code]C:\folder destinations>java -Xmx512m -jar SilabClient.jar 0 0 highmem members 0 C:\folder destinations>pause Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I have not edited anything in the jar or the bat since the last time that it worked and the jar is most definitely called "SilabClient". I've got the .silabclient_store_32 folder in C:\, so I'm really unsure as to what the problem could be; I've already worn out Google and so would appreciate any suggestions. Thanks in advance!

item.title: SilabSoft Client
item.dc:creator: @itskafei itskafei
item.description:
@itskafei wrote:

Chassy13:

Silab client won’t load anyway, at least not for my downloadable version because her site is offline. Download a client and just add the models, it’s long work but I just did it to U-Rune and it works fine. Plus it allows editing…

Heh, I was hoping that it wouldn’t have to get down to being as tedious as that, but I guess it’s the only way. Thanks for your help and taking the time to reply! :﻿)

Read full topic

item.title: SilabSoft Client
item.dc:creator: @itskafei itskafei
item.description:
@itskafei wrote:

[quote=".cLass, post:2, topic:409979"]www.java.com
Download.[/quote]
Ah yes, I probably should have mentioned; I have the latest version of JRE and JDK, and have set my the classpath. I can run other clients fine - this is the only one that has been causing me problems, which is a hassle since it’s the one I need. Any other suggestions?

Read full topic
